org.concordion.ext

Class ScreenshotExtension

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.concordion.ext.ScreenshotExtension
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.concordion.api.extension.ConcordionExtension

    public class ScreenshotExtension
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.concordion.api.extension.ConcordionExtension
    Adds screenshots to the Concordion output, typically when failures or exceptions occur. The screenshot is displayed when you hover over the relevant element. Clicking on the element will open the image in the current browser window.

    It can also be used as a command, to explicitly include screenshots in the output.

    By default, the screenshot will be of the full visible screen. This can be overridden using a custom ScreenshotTaker.

      • setScreenshotTaker

        public ScreenshotExtension setScreenshotTaker(ScreenshotTaker screenshotTaker)
        Set a custom screenshot taker. If not set, the extension will default to using Robot which will take a shot of the full visible screen.
        Parameters:
        screenshotTaker -

      • setMaxWidth

        public ScreenshotExtension setMaxWidth(int maxWidth)
        Sets the maximum width that will be used for display of the images in the output.

      • setScreenshotOnAssertionFailure

        public ScreenshotExtension setScreenshotOnAssertionFailure(boolean takeShot)
        Sets whether screenshots will be embedded in the output when assertions fail. Defaults to true.
        Parameters:
        takeShot - true to take screenshots on assertion failures, false to not take screenshots.

      • setScreenshotOnAssertionSuccess

        public ScreenshotExtension setScreenshotOnAssertionSuccess(boolean takeShot)
        Sets whether screenshots will be embedded in the output when assertions pass. Defaults to false.
        Parameters:
        takeShot - true to take screenshots on assertion success, false to not take screenshots.

      • setScreenshotOnThrowable

        public ScreenshotExtension setScreenshotOnThrowable(boolean takeShot)
        Sets whether screenshots will be embedded in the output when uncaught Throwables occur in the test. Defaults to true.
        Parameters:
        takeShot - true to take screenshots on uncaught Throwables, false to not take screenshots.
